title: Short-Intensive Course on Cervical Anatomy Utilizing 3D Interactive Anatomy (K-12)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic anatomy and medical terminology comprehension, experience with digital learning tools
context.additional_context: 3D interactive e-learning module-based cervical anatomy education in BYOD settings, applying alternative learning methods to address spatial cognition and psychological discomfort in anatomy labs

learning_goals: Accurately identify and explain structural features of the cervical spine (vertebrae, nerves, blood vessels) using 3D interactive tools.
Analyze the three-dimensional spatial relationships of the cervical spine by applying interactive functions (rotation, zoom, layer separation) on a mobile learning platform.
Logically explain clinical applications of cervical spine anatomy (e.g., spinal stenosis) through summative assessments.

resources: Cervical spine anatomy clinical case database

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
